title: Corruption and the Call of Noah
summary: Genesis 6 describes the growing wickedness of humanity, prompting God to bring judgment through a great flood. However, Noah finds favor with God and is instructed to build an ark.

faq.question: Why did God decide to send a flood?
faq.answer: Humanity had become exceedingly corrupt and violent, grieving God's heart.

faq.question: Why was Noah chosen?
faq.answer: Noah was a righteous man who walked with God, making him the exception in a wicked generation.

faq.question: Who were the Nephilim?
faq.answer: They were known as giants or mighty warriors. Other cultures also had stories about giant heroes. In Genesis, they are mentioned during a time when the world was becoming very corrupt.
